snippet: A middle-grade novel invents a spy network of children so ordinary they can carry out their mission without being noticed.
abstract: Renee Dale reviews novel The League of Unexceptional Children by Gitty Daneshvari.
lead_paragraph: A middle-grade novel invents a spy network of children so ordinary they can carry out their mission without being noticed.

headline.main: ‘The League of Unexceptional Children,’ by Gitty Daneshvari
